verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
Hallelujah, what a Saviour!
Who can take a poor lost sinner,
Life him from the miry clay
and set him fee;

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
I will ever tell the story,
Shouting glory,
glory, glory, Hallelujah!
Jesus ransomed me.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
There’s a sweet and blessed story
Of the Christ who came from glory,
Just to rescue me
from sin and misery’

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
He in loving kindness sought me,
And from sin and
shame hath bro’t me,
Hallelujah! Jesus ransomed me.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
From the depth of sin and sadness
To the heights of joy and gladness
Jesus lifted me,
in mercy full and free;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
With His precious blood He bo’t me.
When I knew Him not,
He sought me,
And in love divine
He ransomed me.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
From the throne of heavenly glory
Oh, the sweet and blessed story!
Jesus came to lift
the lost in sin and woe

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Into liberty all glorious,
Trophies of His grace victorious,
Evermore rejoicing here below.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
By and by with joy increasing,
And with gratitude unceasing,
Lifted up with Christ
forever more to be;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
I will join the hosts there singing,
In the anthem ever ringing,
To the King of Love
who ransomed me.
